CONJUGATES: outdate (v) | outdates (v) | outdating (v) | more outdated (adj) | most outdated (adj)
ETYMOLOGY: Compound formed from the prefix 'out-' (meaning beyond or exceeding) and the verb 'date' (referring to time). The word is the past participle of the verb 'outdate', used adjectivally.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: No longer current, useful, or fashionable; obsolete or old-fashioned.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 过时的；陈旧的；不合时宜的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Their technology is completely outdated compared to modern standards.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 与现代标准相比，他们的技术已经完全过时了。

REGISTER: General usage, applicable in formal and informal contexts.
